item.description:
Part 3 of the Connecticut Appalachian Trail!  This is the longest section in Connecticut at 13.2 miles. The largest elevation gain at one time is around 750 feet but this whole hike is up and down....so its going to be a grind. A good test of our endurance! I would guess we'll finish this section in about 8 or 9 hours.

 

We'll meet at an off road parking area on route 7 just north of where route 7 and route 12 intersect in Falls Village, CT, which is the ending spot of our hike. We'll leave half the cars here and head down to the trail head on river road in Sharon CT where we ended our last hike.

 

For more detailed information on the hike, please see the following link. Note that this link starts from rt 4....we are starting a mile further south at river road because of easier parking....but besides that its the same hike.

Trail Description

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a long hike with lots of small elevation gains and drops. Nothing too challenging, more of an endurance hike. Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton, hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks.


Trailhead Directions (our meeting place, the end of the hike):

From Providence about 3 hours

There is parking right along route 7 on the east side of the road, just north of the intersection of routes 112 and 7.

Google Map:
Google Maps Link

Coordinates: 41.93258,-73.363422

 

For reference, the coordinates of the start of the hike, where we will be driving to as a group:

Coordinates: 41.807704,-73.391782

 

Connecticut Section Map


Carpool Option:

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool. Keep in mind that car spotting is involved!


Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking lot on the east side of rt 7 just north of the rt 7 and 112 intersection. My Cell: 508-414-8544
item.name: Connecticut Appalachian Trail: Part 3
